name: Midjourney
purpose: AI image generation for concept art, illustrations, and visual ideation
description: AI-powered text-to-image generation tool accessed via Discord and web interface. Advanced platform offering extensive control over image generation through parameters, seed references, image references, remix features, and built-in editor. Used for banners, icons, flat illustrations, concept exploration, visual references, pattern creation, and professional design workflows. Features comprehensive organization tools including smart folders, filters, and community features.
integration_capabilities: Image references (character, style, image, prompt) with image weights (--iw 0-1000)
Parameter customization (AR, stylize, weird, chaos, speed, stealth, stop, tile, --no)
Remix feature for combining multiple references
Filter system (liked, unrated, hidden, types, aspect ratios, versions)

actual_remote_helpers_usage.primary_use: AI Image Generation for Design Concepts
team_members: Social media managers for engaging visuals

steps: Craft detailed prompt with visual style, composition, colors
Use parameters (--ar 16:9 for banner aspect ratio, --v 6 for latest model)
Import into Photoshop or Figma for refinement
Add text, branding, and final touches
Define illustration style in prompt (flat, isometric, etc.)
Use --sref for style consistency across series
Use as reference for manual illustration in Illustrator
Define thumbnail concept with high-impact visuals
Use prompt specifying 'bold text area', 'high contrast', 'dramatic composition'
Reference successful thumbnail styles (e.g., Mr. Beast style) with --sref
Use aspect ratio --ar 16:9 for YouTube format
Generate multiple variations for A/B testing
Import to Photoshop to add bold text overlay
Optimize for click-through rate (vibrant colors, clear focal point)

typical_workflows.task: Create Frame-to-Frame Transition Video for Viral Hook
steps: Export end frame from original video (person)
Export start frame from AI-animated video (character)
Upload AI character frame as 'Ending Frame'
Write transformation prompt (e.g., 'his skin turns blue and then he turns into an alien. No talking.')
Set motion to 'High' for dynamic transitions
Set resolution to 'HD' to avoid post-upscaling
Import to Premiere Pro and speed up (5 sec → 1 sec compression) for smoothness
typical_workflows.tools_involved: Midjourney, Premiere Pro, Veo 3, Nano Banana

typical_workflows.task: Generate Image Using Multiple References (Remix Feature)
steps: Click and drag references to prompt bar
Choose reference types (character, style, image, prompt)
Optionally refine with variations or upscaling

typical_workflows.task: Create Style-Consistent Image Series Using Seeds
steps: Find style seed code from Explore page or chat
Optionally add image reference with image weight (--iw 0-1000)
Add aspect ratio parameter (--ar 16:9 or custom)
Use curly brackets for multiple parameter values {0.1, 0.2, 0.3}
Compare results with different parameter values

typical_workflows.task: Edit Generated Image Using Built-in Editor
Create Seamless Pattern Using Tile Parameter
steps: Optionally add stop parameter (--stop 90) for softer look
Export pattern for use in design projects

typical_workflows.task: Organize Generated Images with Smart Folders
steps: Create smart folder with search terms
Set filter criteria (liked, unrated, hidden, types, aspect ratios, versions)
Use view options to adjust layout
Select multiple images for batch actions
Download, publish, or organize into folders
Use filters to find specific image types
Enter prompt with concepts separated by ::
Use two colons to separate concepts
Adjust weights to control concept prominence
Verify excluded elements are not present
Add 7-20 images from gallery, computer, or web links
Select images with similar visual style
Click Copy Code to get profile code
Use code in prompt with --profile parameter
Adjust stylize value (--s 0-1000) to control moodboard influence
View Creations to see all images made with that moodboard

typical_workflows.task: Create Standard Profile by Ranking Images
steps: Rank minimum 40 pairs to unlock first profile code
Continue ranking for more refined personalization (100+ recommended)
Use code in prompt with --profile parameter
Test with various prompts to see personalized style
typical_workflows.note: Moodboards recommended over Standard Profiles for better control

typical_workflows.task: Maintain Character Consistency with Character Reference
steps: Generate or select base character image (must be Midjourney-generated)
Upload image or select from gallery
Use --cw 100 for full character including clothing/hair
typical_workflows.limitations: Works best with Midjourney-generated images, not real photos

steps: Click More Options → Open in Full Editor
Enter new style prompt (e.g., '1990s anime look', 'watercolor style')
typical_workflows.requirements: Full Editor access (10,000+ images, 12-month subscription, or annual plan)

typical_workflows.task: Apply Triple Triple Technique for Unique Results
steps: Select 3 different images from Explore or gallery
Drag first image to prompt box
Hold Shift key and click all three reference types for each image
Apply: Image Prompt + Style Reference + Character Reference
Write simple prompt (e.g., 'Ya' or single word)
typical_workflows.note: Results are highly experimental and unpredictable

prompt_best_practices: Include specific visual style (flat, isometric, photorealistic, etc.)
Specify composition and framing
Use --no parameter to exclude unwanted elements
Reference existing images with --cref for consistency
Use --ow (organization weight) for brand consistency
For thumbnails: specify 'high contrast', 'dramatic', 'bold composition'
For CTR optimization: request 'eye-catching', 'vibrant colors', 'clear focal point'
Use --ar 16:9 for YouTube thumbnails
Reference viral thumbnail styles with --sref for proven formats
For frame-to-frame transitions: use 'High' motion setting for dynamic effects
For transitions: select HD output to avoid post-upscaling
For transitions: add 'No talking' to prompts if dialogue not needed
Speed up generated transitions in post-production (5 sec → 1 sec) for smoother morphs
Use seed references (--sref) with style weights (--sw 0-1000) for style consistency
Combine multiple image references (character, style, image) for complex compositions
Use remix feature for combining references without complex prompting
Use curly brackets {value1, value2, value3} to test multiple parameter values
Separate concepts using :: (two colons) with weight ratios (concept1::4 concept2::1)
Use --stop parameter (0-100) for softer, blurrier effects (useful for backgrounds)
Use --tile parameter for seamless pattern generation
Use image weights (--iw 0-1000) to control reference influence
Lock references in prompt bar to prevent accidental changes
Use smart folders with search terms for automatic organization
Filter images by liked, unrated, hidden, types, aspect ratios, or versions
Use editor for fine-tuning specific parts without regenerating entire image

aspect_ratio.description: Controls image dimensions and aspect ratio

stylization.description: Controls how strongly Midjourney aesthetics are applied

weirdness.description: Controls how quirky and creative generations are

chaos.description: Controls variation between the 4 generated images

speed.values: fast (default, less detail) or slow (more detail)
speed.description: Controls generation speed vs quality trade-off
speed.example: Use slow for detailed images, fast for quick iterations

stealth.description: Hides image from public Explore page

stop.description: Stops generation early for softer, blurrier effects

seed_reference.description: Uses specific seed for style consistency

character_reference.limitations: Works best with Midjourney-generated images, not real photos

character_weight.description: Controls character reference influence (0=face only, 100=full character)

profile.values: profile code from moodboard or standard profile
profile.description: Applies personalized style from moodboards or ranked preferences

remix_feature.description: Combines multiple image references (character, style, seed) with simple prompt
remix_feature.use_case: Complex image creation without extensive prompt engineering
remix_feature.workflow: Select references → Enter simple prompt → Generate combined result

editor.description: Built-in editor for fine-tuning specific parts of generated images
editor.access: Available to all users (full editor requires yearly subscription)
editor.use_case: Fix specific issues without regenerating entire image

smart_folders.use_case: Managing large collections of generated images

filters.use_case: Quickly find specific images in large collections

zoom_pan.description: Zoom into or pan around generated images
zoom_pan.use_case: Exploring details or creating variations of specific areas

personalization.description: AI learns your preferences after rating 40 images

internal_platforms_served: DGN (Design Services) - Concept art, portfolio pieces
BZ-V (Business Video) - Background imagery, concepts, transition videos
REMS (Recruiting) - Visual content for job market insights
Viral Content Creation - Frame-to-frame character transformation videos

strengths: Extremely fast concept generation
High-quality, artistic outputs
Great for visual exploration
Excellent for mood boards
Reduces initial sketching time
Style consistency with parameters, seeds, and references
Comprehensive parameter control (AR, stylize, weird, chaos, etc.)
Remix feature for complex image creation
Built-in editor for fine-tuning
Smart folders and filters for organization
Seed reference system for style consistency
Pattern creation with tile parameter
Concept separation with weight ratios
Exclusion function for unwanted elements
Zoom and pan features
Personalization profiles for style consistency
Moodboard system for custom style collections (7-20 images)
Standard profiles via image ranking (40+ pairs minimum)
Character reference system for consistent characters (--cref, --cw)
Retexture feature for style transformation while preserving structure
Triple triple technique for experimental multi-reference combinations
Community features (chat, tasks, profiles)
Frame-to-frame transition video generation
High motion control for dynamic transitions
HD video output without post-upscaling needed
Both Discord and web interface access
limitations: Full editor requires yearly subscription and usage threshold
Seed discovery requires research or experimentation
Remix feature may not always combine references perfectly
Editor has limitations compared to professional image editing software
